metadata.title: [System Name] FedRAMP Security Assessment Plan (SAP)

roles.title: Prepared By
roles.desc: The organization that prepared this SAP.

roles.title: Prepared For
roles.desc: The organization for which this SAP was prepared. Typically the CSP.

roles.title: Security Assessment Plan Approval
roles.desc: The individual or individuals accountable for the accuracy of this SAP.

roles.title: Assessment Team
roles.desc: The individual or individuals performing the assessment.

roles.title: Assessment Lead
roles.desc: The individual leading the assessment activities.

roles.title: Penetration Test Team
roles.desc: The individual or individuals performing the penetration test.

roles.title: Penetration Test Lead
roles.desc: The individual leading the penetration test activities.

roles.title: Assessment Organization's Managerial POC
roles.desc: The management-level POC within the assessor's organization accountable for the organization's assessment performance.

roles.title: CSP POCs During Testing
roles.desc: At least three CSP testing points of contact must be identified in a FedRAMP SAP.

roles.title: CSP Operations POC
roles.desc: An operations center role, such as a SOC or NOC.

roles.title: CSP's End of Testing Notification POC
roles.desc: A role for an individual within the CSP to be notified by the assessor when testing is complete.

roles.title: CSP Results POCs
roles.desc: A role for the individuals within the CSP who are to receive the assessment results.

locations.title: Assessor's HQ
locations.remarks:
The assessor's HQ, or the address of the assessment team's primary business
               location.

parties.remarks: Replace sample 3PAO information.\n\nIf the assessor is A2LA Certified, include the ISO/IEC-17020

prepared-by.remarks: Exactly one party\n\nThis is the assessor.

prepared-for.remarks:
Exactly one party.

This is the UUID for the CSP in the imported SSP.

If no OSCAL-based SSP exists, create a CSP party in the SAP, and provide that UUID here.

csp-operations-center.remarks:
Exactly one party

The party-uuid should observation-source a party in the SSP.

If an appropriate party does not exist in the SSP, the SAP tool should add a party to
               the SAP, or have the CSP add the party to the SSP.

The SAP tool should not modify the SSP.

csp-assessment-poc.remarks:
There should be at least three CSP Assessment POCs.

At least one should be available 24x7 during assessment activities.

At least one should be an operations center, such a SOC or NOC.

The party-uuid should observation-source a party in the SSP or SAP.

If an appropriate party does not exist in the SSP or SAP, the SAR tool should add a
               party to the SAR.

The SAP tool should not modify the SSP.

metadata.remarks:
This OSCAL-based FedRAMP SAP Template can be used for the FedRAMP initial or annual
            assessment planning.

import-ssp.remarks:
Link the SAP to the SSP.

FedRAMP prefers the path for the SSP be relative to the location of this SAP file.
            Absolute links will likely not work when FedRAMP tools import the content.

This may point to a back-matter resource using a URI fragment.

If no OSCAL-based SSP exists, this must be a URI fragment pointing to a special
            back-matter resource. The resource must include the `no-oscal-ssp` conformity
            tag.

control-group.description:
Include all controls in the baseline.

Then exclude any specific controls if necessary.

Provide rationale/justification for control exclusion here.

control-objective-group.description:
Includes all objectives for all in-scope controls as defined in the controls
               assembly.

part.name: objective
part.title: SAP Inserted Objective
part.prose: Custom assessment objective for this control.

part.name: objects
part.prose: Unusual policy\n\nUnexpected procedure addressing client access

part.name: objects
part.prose: Organizational personnel responsible for Unexpected Procedure

objectives.remarks: THIS DEFINES THE APPLICABLE ASSESSMENT OBJECTIVES FROM THE CONTROL BASELINE

excludes.remarks: This section identifies what to exclude.\n\nThis is focused on inventory-items.

0f9049ed-a01f-484a-b70d-b1894fd196b8.description: A Windows laptop, not defined in the SSP inventory.

59406025-116a-4fee-84c3-932a9968de54.description: A known subnet, which is not defined in the SSP inventory.

ce6b1a6e-0391-45d1-997e-3cc97db97d9f.description: A network appliance, not defined in the SSP inventory.

ba6b8bd4-c6f1-4b60-aa0f-69875b108f16.title: Existing Role - Incorrect Associated Functions
ba6b8bd4-c6f1-4b60-aa0f-69875b108f16.remarks:
The ID assigned to this incorrect role must be identical to the entry in the SSP
                  user list, which is being corrected.

The SAP user assembly duplicates the SSP user assembly, which requires a
                  role-id.

If an existing role in the SSP is appropriate, reference it here.

If no appropriate role exists in the SSP, the role-id may be left blank in the
                  SAP.

58bb5a77-b40a-4104-ac29-299a1691f76a.title: Missing Role
58bb5a77-b40a-4104-ac29-299a1691f76a.remarks:
The ID assigned to this missing role must not be used in the SSP user list.

The SAP user assembly duplicates the SSP user assembly, which requires a
                  role-id.

If an existing role in the SSP is appropriate, reference it here.

If no appropriate role exists in the SSP, the role-id may be left blank in the
                  SAP.

assessment-subjects.remarks:
All uuid-refs cited in the include-subject and exclude-subject point to items in the
            imported SSP, this SAP, or both.

If the assessor needs to create or correct SSP content, the SAP tool should create that
            content in the SAP, not the SSP, so it is attributable to the assessor. (The assessor
            may ask the CSP to change the SSP, but the assessor must not change the SSP content on
            behalf of the CSP.)

For content that does not exist in the SSP, the SAP tool must ensure an ID is used that
            is both unique in the SAP and does not exist in the SSP.

When the same ID is found in both the SSP and the SAP, the SAP tool should treat the
            associated content in the SAP as adding to or overriding the content in the SSP. (This
            is how assessors correct inaccurate SSP content without changing the SSP itself.)

When missing or incorrect SSP content needs to be added to the SAP, the SAP tool should
            place the content in the SAP as follows:

* Components: local-definitions
* Inventory Items: local-definitions
* User Roles: local-definitions
* Locations: metadata

040937c3-2e0e-407a-bb3c-d4e61ac1c460.title: XYZ Vulnerability Scanning Tool
040937c3-2e0e-407a-bb3c-d4e61ac1c460.description: Describe the purpose of the tool here.

c50104b9-69b3-4383-a1f1-d8a6f6f806f7.description: Describe the purpose of the tool here.

properties.name: results-delivery
properties.value: 10 business days after completion of assessment

annotations.name: limitation
annotations.remarks:
**Limitation of Liability**\n\nThis is a limitation statement, such as a liability limitation, that would appear in
               the rules of engagement.

parts.name: assumption
parts.prose:
[CSP Name] resources, including documentation and individuals with knowledge of the
               [CSP Name] systems and infrastructure and their contact information, will be
               available to [3PAO Name] staff during the time necessary to complete assessments.

parts.name: assumption
parts.prose:
The [CSP Name] will provide login account information/credentials necessary for [3PAO
               Name] to use its testing devices to perform authenticated scans of devices and
               applications.

parts.name: assumption
parts.prose:
The [CSP Name] will permit [3PAO Name] to connect its testing laptops to the [CSP
               Name] networks defined within the scope of this assessment.

parts.name: assumption
parts.prose:
The [CSP Name] will permit communication from Third Party Assessment Organization
               testing appliances to an internet hosted vulnerability management service to permit
               the analysis of vulnerability data.

parts.name: assumption
parts.prose:
Security controls that have been identified as “Not Applicable” in the SSP will be
               verified as such and further testing will not be performed on these security
               controls.

parts.name: assumption
parts.prose:
Significant upgrades or changes to the infrastructure and components of the system
               undergoing testing will not be performed during the security assessment period.

parts.name: assumption
parts.prose:
For onsite control assessment, [CSP Name] personnel will be available should the
               [3PAO Name] staff determine that either after hours work, or weekend work, is
               necessary to support the security assessment.

parts.name: methodology
parts.prose:
[3PAO Name] will perform an assessment of the Information System Abbreviation security
            controls using the methodology described in NIST SP 800-53A. [3PAO Name] will use
            FedRAMP test procedures to evaluate the security controls. Contained in Excel
            worksheets, these test procedures contain the test objectives and associated test cases
            to determine if a control is effectively implemented and operating as intended. The
            results of the testing shall be recorded in the worksheets (provided in Appendix B)
            along with information that notes whether the control (or control enhancement) is
            satisfied or not.

[3PAO Name] data gathering activities will consist of the following:

* Request [CSP Name] provide FedRAMP required documentation
* Request any follow-up documentation, files, or information needed that is not
               provided in FedRAMP required documentation
* Travel to the [CSP Name] sites as necessary to inspect systems and meet with [CSP
               Name] staff
* Obtain information through the use of security testing tools


Security controls will be verified using one or more of the following assessment
            methods:

* Examine: the IA will review, analyze, inspect, or observe one or more assessment
               artifacts as specified in the attached test cases
* Interview: the IA will conduct discussions with individuals within the organization
               to facilitate assessor understanding, achieve clarification, or obtain evidence
* Technical Tests: the IA will perform technical tests, including penetration testing,
               on system components using automated and manual methods


[3PAO Name] [ will | will not ] use sampling when performing this assessment.

parts.name: disclosure
parts.prose:
Any testing will be performed according to terms and conditions designed to minimize
               risk exposure that could occur during security testing.

parts.name: liability-limitation
parts.prose:
[3PAO Name], and its stated partners, shall not be held liable to [CSP Name] for any
               and all liabilities, claims, or damages arising out of or relating to the security
               vulnerability testing portion of this agreement, howsoever caused and regardless of
               the legal theory asserted, including breach of contract or warranty, tort, strict
               liability, statutory liability, or otherwise.

parts.name: liability-limitation
parts.prose:
[CSP Name] acknowledges that there are limitations inherent in the methodologies
               implemented, and the assessment of security and vulnerability relating to information
               technology is an uncertain process based on past experiences, currently available
               information, and the anticipation of reasonable threats at the time of the analysis.
               There is no assurance that an analysis of this nature will identify all
               vulnerabilities or propose exhaustive and operationally viable recommendations to
               mitigate all exposure.

test-methods.title: [SAMPLE]Forceful Browsing
test-methods.description:
We will login as a customer and try to see if we can gain access to the Network
               Administrator and Database Administrator privileges and authorizations by navigating
               to different views and manually forcing the browser to various URLs

test-methods.title: [SAMPLE]CAPTCHA
test-methods.description: We will test the CAPTCHA function on the web form manually

test-methods.title: [SAMPLE]OCSP
test-methods.description: We will manually test to see if OCSP is validating certificates.

tasks.title: Send Final Version of SAR to CSP and ISSO

include-activities.description: Port scans and other network service interaction and queries
Network sniffing, traffic monitoring, traffic analysis, and host discovery
Attempted logins or other use of systems, with any account name/password

Attempted structured query language (SQL) injection and other forms of input
               parameter testing
Use of exploit code for leveraging discovered vulnerabilities
Password cracking via capture and scanning of authentication databases
Spoofing or deceiving servers regarding network traffic
Altering running system configuration except where denial of service would result

exclude-activities.description: Modification of user files or system files
Telephone modem probes and scans (active and passive)

Intentional viewing of [CSP Name] staff email, Internet caches, and/or personnel
               cookie files
Exploits that will introduce new weaknesses to the system
Intentional introduction of malicious code (viruses, Trojans, worms, etc.)

resources.title: System's Full Name

properties.name: purpose
properties.value: Briefly state the system's purpose. This will appear in the SAR.

properties.name: description
properties.value: Briefly describe the system. This will appear in the SAR.

resources.remarks: Only include this resource if no OSCAL-based SSP is available.\n\nDelete it otherwise.

resources.title: [System Name] [FIPS-199 Level] SSP
resources.remarks: Use this to point to an OSCAL-based SSP.\n\nFor FedRAMP, do not attach the SSP. This should be delivered by the CSP.

FedRAMP is formulating guidelines for handling digital/electronic signatures in OSCAL, and welcome feedback on solutions.

For now, FedRAMP recommends one of the following:

* Render the OSCAL SAP content as a PDF that is digitally signed and attached.
* Render the OSCAL SAP content as a printed page that is physically signed, scanned, and attached.


If your organization prefers another approach, please seek prior approval from the FedRAMP PMO.
